title: Install OO on OpenShift
content:
To install OO Containerized on OpenShift, run the following command on the bastion node. If you use custom values for resources in the values.yaml file, the global.oo.size parameter gets disabled.

 

If you're adding certificates at Helm install time using CLI, ensure to remove the caCertificates parameter from the values.yaml file.

$CDF_HOME/bin/helm install <OO INSTALL NAME> <OO CHART FILE> --namespace <OO NAMESPACE> -f <values.yaml> --set global.oo.size=xx --set-file "caCertificates.cert_one\.crt"=/path/to/cert_one.crt

Where:

  • $CDF_HOME is the installation directory of OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT).
  • <OO INSTALL NAME> is the unique release name you need to specify for the OO deployment. 
  • <OO CHART FILE> is the absolute path of the OO chart file.
  • <OO NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the OO deployment.

  • <values.yaml> is the path to OO values.yaml file which you configured as part of the preparation step Create values.yaml for OO.

  • <global.oo.size> = the number of tenants in the OO deployment. Value is between 1 and 20. Default value is 5, if you don't configure this parameter.
  • <--set-file> are optional arguments because they address one way of having OO trust-specific certificates. Depending on your choice during the preparation of OO values.yaml (see suite integration parameters):
    • If you opted to provide the required certificates at OO install time, you must use the --set-file parameter.
    • If you provided the certificates directly in the OO values.yaml, then don't use the --set-file parameter with the Helm install command.

For example:

$CDF_HOME/bin/helm install oo oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/charts/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x.tgz --namespace oo -f values.yaml --set global.oo.size=5 --set-file "caCertificates.smax_lb\.crt"=/opt/oo/smax_lb.crt --set-file "caCertificates.oo_db\.crt"=/opt/oo/oo_db.crt

You can run the command with the --dry-run parameter to simulate an installation. It's useful to validate the content in the values.yaml file before a real installation.
